screeners.title: All stocks
screeners.summary: All US stocks
screeners.description: Stocks are fungible financial instruments, representing ownership in a company. Traders invest in stocks to capitalize on the difference between buying and selling prices, or dividends. See all US stocks below, sorted alphabetically.

screeners.title: Large-cap
screeners.summary: Large cap US companies
screeners.description: US companies below have the highest value on the market. These are well-known, established companies and sector leaders. Find them sorted by market cap and check their stats to see why they’re doing so great.

screeners.title: Small-cap
screeners.summary: US companies with small market cap
screeners.description: Explore US companies with the smallest capitalization: their shares might be pretty volatile, but sometimes — more profitable. The smallest value companies are on top: study all available data to make informed decisions.

screeners.title: Largest employers
screeners.summary: US companies with the most employees
screeners.description: Below are US companies that have the largest workforce. Sorted by the number of employees, they can be growing or holding a stable position in the market, so analyze them to find a reliable investment.

screeners.title: High-dividend
screeners.summary: US companies with the highest dividend yields
screeners.description: High dividends could signify a source of stable gains. US companies below pay the highest dividends in the market: see them sorted by forward dividend yield and check out other stats too.

screeners.title: Highest net income
screeners.summary: US companies with the highest net income
screeners.description: Net income shows the company's real profitability and how well it is managed. US companies below have the highest net income in their market. They're sorted by this indicator, but also have other ones to study.

screeners.title: Highest cash
screeners.summary: US companies with the most cash on hand
screeners.description: The total amount of cash accessible to a business can be seen as a measure of the company's financial health. US companies with the most cash on hand are gathered below with all important stats.

screeners.title: Highest profit per employee
screeners.summary: US companies with the highest profit per employee
screeners.description: Profit per employee calculates how much profit each employee brings to the company over a period of time. The metric can show how profitable a company is relative to the number of employees that it has.

screeners.title: Highest revenue per employee
screeners.summary: US companies generating the most revenue per employee
screeners.description: Revenue per employee is a rough measurement of how much money each employee generates. US companies in the list below have the highest revenue per employee.

screeners.title: Top gainers
screeners.summary: US stocks that increased the most in price
screeners.description: US companies below are top stock gainers: they've shown the biggest daily growth in price. But there's always a risk of retracement — so make sure to consider all stats, including share price and market cap.

screeners.title: Biggest losers
screeners.summary: US stocks that lost the most in price
screeners.description: US companies below are the biggest stock losers today. They are outsiders now, but may provide trade opportunities in the future, so make sure to check all their stats.

screeners.title: Most active
screeners.summary: Most actively traded US stocks
screeners.description: The most active US stocks in the market can be found below. Companies are sorted by daily volume and supplied with other stats to help you find out why they are so popular right now.

screeners.title: Pre-market gainers
screeners.summary: Top gaining US stocks in pre-market
screeners.description: US stocks below are pre-market gainers: they increased the most in price before the start of regular trading hours. They're sorted by pre-market price change, but other stats are also available.

screeners.title: Pre-market losers
screeners.summary: Top losing US stocks in pre-market
screeners.description: US stocks in the list below dropped the most in price before the market opened. Traders watch pre-market losers to detect downtrends: check available metrics to prepare for regular trading hours.

screeners.title: Pre-market most active
screeners.summary: Most actively traded US stocks in pre-market
screeners.description: US stocks below were the most actively traded in the pre-market. They often show large price movements and potential for gains (or additional risk). Stocks are sorted by pre-market volume, but have other important stats too.

screeners.title: Pre-market gap
screeners.summary: US stocks with the biggest gap in pre-market
screeners.description: Gap is a sharp change in a stock price between sessions when no actual trading occurs. US stocks below have gained the most in pre-market gap. Check their stats and see if you can gain from this sudden change.

screeners.title: After-hours gainers
screeners.summary: Top gaining US stocks in post-market
screeners.description: US stocks below gained the most in price during the post-market session. They are sorted by post-market price percentage change and supplied with other important metrics, including volume and market cap.

screeners.title: After-hours losers
screeners.summary: Top losing US stocks in post-market
screeners.description: Post-market trading risk is often compensated by the timing advantage. US stocks below are the biggest losers of the last after-hours session, they’re sorted by post-market price change and supplied with other stats too.

screeners.title: After-hours most active
screeners.summary: Most actively traded US stocks in post-market
screeners.description: In the post-market, fewer shares are required to make an impact, so traders use it to quickly adjust strategies. Sorted by post-market volume, US stocks below were traded the most actively in the after-hours session.

screeners.title: Unusual volume
screeners.summary: US stocks with unusual trading volume
screeners.description: Unusually high or low volume may influence future prices, so it's useful to detect it to make timely decisions. US stocks below show out-of-the-ordinary trading volume now and are sorted by relative volume.

screeners.title: Most volatile
screeners.summary: Most volatile US stocks
screeners.description: Market volatility brings risk, which many traders take hoping for profits. US stocks in the list below are the most volatile in the market. They’re sorted by daily volatility and supplied with important metrics.

screeners.title: High beta
screeners.summary: US stocks with high beta
screeners.description: Beta measures a stock's volatility and is often used by risk-tolerant traders. US stocks below have the highest beta: they're sorted by yearly beta and together with other metrics can help you make an informed decision.

screeners.title: Best performing
screeners.summary: US stocks with the best yearly performance
screeners.description: See shares that show the most potential at the moment: US stocks below are filtered by yearly performance, so you can see how much they gained over 12 months. Compare their stats to make an informed decision.

screeners.title: Highest revenue
screeners.summary: US companies with the highest revenue
screeners.description: Make use of the list below: these US companies show the highest revenue and are sorted by this metric. It can be helpful for growth investors looking for companies making more sales than anybody else.

screeners.title: Most expensive
screeners.summary: US stocks with the highest price
screeners.description: Below are US stocks that boast the highest stock price today. They're sorted by price, but other metrics are available too: P/E ratio, market cap, price change, and more.

screeners.title: Penny stocks
screeners.summary: Penny stocks — US stocks
screeners.description: US stocks with low prices in one list: available to a wider range of investors, they can potentially bring gains, but can be highly volatile too. We sorted them by price and supplied with important metrics to watch.

screeners.title: Pink sheet
screeners.summary: US stocks that trade over-the-counter
screeners.description: US companies below don’t trade on major exchanges, and traders often track them to find additional trading opportunities. The list of OTC stocks is sorted by market cap and also helps watch share price, change, and more.

screeners.title: Overbought
screeners.summary: Most overvalued US stocks
screeners.description: Overbought US stocks are gathered in the list below and sorted by Relative Strength Index: it will help you see the speed and magnitude of price changes and maybe capitalize on their anticipated price decline.

screeners.title: Oversold
screeners.summary: Most undervalued US stocks
screeners.description: US stocks that are oversold are listed below and sorted by Relative Strength Index: it shows the speed and magnitude of price changes. With these, traders can gain from the future rebound and play on price instability.

screeners.title: All-time high
screeners.summary: US stocks at their all-time highs
screeners.description: These US stocks have reached their all-time highs: we sorted them alphabetically and equipped with companies' financials — analyze to see if there will be a correction, or if they will keep going up.

screeners.title: All-time low
screeners.summary: US stocks at their all-time lows
screeners.description: These US stocks are at their all-time lowest prices: we sorted them alphabetically and supplied with companies' financials to help you decide which ones can actually go back up.

screeners.title: 52-week high
screeners.summary: US stocks at their highest yearly price
screeners.description: US companies below have reached their highest stock price in 52 weeks: check out their trading volume, price change, and other stats to see if there will be an even bigger future growth.

screeners.title: 52-week low
screeners.summary: US stocks at their lowest yearly price
screeners.description: Below, US stocks at their 52-week lows are gathered in one list: study their performance and companies' financials to see which ones have potential to grow back.
